17  KESSElasticElsepa::KESSElasticElsepa()
18  {
19  fInteraction = string( "Elastic" );
20  ReadMFP( "Elsepa_MFP.txt", fElScMFPMap );
21  ReadPDF( "Elsepa.txt", fElScMap );
22  }

24  KESSElasticElsepa::KESSElasticElsepa (const KESSElasticElsepa &aCopy ):
25  KSComponent(),
26  fElScMFPMap( aCopy.fElScMFPMap ),
27  fElScMap( aCopy.fElScMap )
28  {
29  fInteraction = aCopy.fInteraction;

41  void KESSElasticElsepa::CalculateCrossSection( const KSParticle& aParticle, double& aCrossSection)
42  {
43  double tKineticEnergy = aParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV();
44 
45  //map iterator to the maps above and below electronEnergy_eV
46  std::map< double, double >::iterator mapAbove, mapBelow;
47 
48  //find dictionary entry - mapAbove is the energy area ABOVE electronEnergy_eV
49  mapAbove = fElScMFPMap.lower_bound( tKineticEnergy );
50 
51  //mapBelow the energy area BELOW electronEnergy_eV
52  mapBelow = mapAbove;
53  mapBelow--;
54 
55  double elMFP1 = mapBelow->second;
56  double elMFP2 = mapAbove->second;
57 
58  double elENE1 = mapBelow->first;
59  double elENE2 = mapAbove->first;
60 
61  //linear interpolation
62  double MeanFreePathAngstroem = this->InterpolateLinear( tKineticEnergy,
63  elENE1,
64  elENE2,
65  elMFP1,
66  elMFP2 );
67 
68  //aCrossSection = 12.06 * 1E-6 / (MeanFreePathAngstroem * 1E-10 * KConst::N_A());
69  // Molar Volume of Silicon = 12.06 * 1E-6 m^3/mol
70  aCrossSection = 12.06 / ( MeanFreePathAngstroem * 1E-4 * KConst::N_A() );
71  }
72 
73  void KESSElasticElsepa::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle,
74  KSParticle& aFinalParticle,
75  KSParticleQueue& /*aQueue*/ )
76  {
77  //Elastic scattering doesn't change the Energy
78  double tKineticEnergy_eV = anInitialParticle.GetKineticEnergy_eV();
79 
80  //computes the new polar angle due to scattering
81  double tTheta = GetScatteringPolarAngle( tKineticEnergy_eV );
82  intmsg_debug( "KESSElasticElsepa::Execute" << ret
83  << "Elastic Calculator computed Theta = " << 180*tTheta/KConst::Pi() <<eom );
84 
85  //dice an azimuthal angle
86  double tPhi = 2. * KConst::Pi() * KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform();
87 
88  intmsg_debug( "KESSElasticElsepa::Execute" << ret
89  << "Randomly chosen azimuthal angle: " << 180*tPhi/KConst::Pi() <<eom );
90 
91  //update the final particle
92  KThreeVector tInitialDirection = anInitialParticle.GetMomentum();
93  KThreeVector tOrthogonalOne = tInitialDirection.Orthogonal();
94  KThreeVector tOrthogonalTwo = tInitialDirection.Cross( tOrthogonalOne );
95  KThreeVector tFinalDirection = tInitialDirection.Magnitude() *
96  ( sin( tTheta ) * (cos( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalOne.Unit() + sin( tPhi ) * tOrthogonalTwo.Unit())
97  + cos( tTheta ) * tInitialDirection.Unit()
98  );
99 
100  aFinalParticle = anInitialParticle;
101  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( tFinalDirection );
102  aFinalParticle.SetKineticEnergy_eV( tKineticEnergy_eV );
103  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
104 
105 
106  fStepNInteractions = 1;
107  fStepEnergyLoss = 0.;
108  }
109 
110  double KESSElasticElsepa::GetScatteringPolarAngle( const double& aKineticEnergy )
111  {
112 
113  double scatteringAngle_pi = 0;
114  double rand2 = KRandom::GetInstance().Uniform();
115 
116  //map iterator to the maps above and below the kinetic energy of the electron
117  std::map< double, std::vector< std::vector< double > > >::iterator mapAbove, mapBelow;
118 
119  //vector iterator for integral (probability)
120  std::vector< double >::iterator intBelow, intAbove;
121 
122  //value (energy loss)
123  double valBelow, valAbove;
124 
125  //find dictionary entry - mapAbove is the energy area ABOVE the kinetic energy of the electron
126  mapAbove = fElScMap.lower_bound( aKineticEnergy );
127 
128  //mapBelow the energy area BELOW the kinetic energy of the electron
129  mapBelow = mapAbove;
130  mapBelow--;
131 
132  //search for the values above and below the probability integral
133  intAbove = mapAbove->second.at( 1 ).end();
134  intBelow = mapAbove->second.at( 1 ).begin();
135  intAbove = std::lower_bound( intBelow, intAbove, rand2 );
136 
137  intBelow = intAbove;
138  intBelow--;
139 
140  //fill the variables with the according energy losses
141  valAbove = mapAbove->second.at( 0 ).at( intAbove - mapAbove->second.at( 1 ).begin() );
142  valBelow = mapAbove->second.at( 0 ).at( intBelow - mapAbove->second.at( 1 ).begin() );
143 
144  //interpolate to actual random number and save
145  double resultAbove = this->InterpolateLinear( rand2, *intBelow, *intAbove, valBelow, valAbove );
146 
147  //see above (but now for the lower energy area
148  intAbove = mapBelow->second.at( 1 ).end();
149  intBelow = mapBelow->second.at( 1 ).begin();
150 
151  intAbove = std::lower_bound( intBelow, intAbove, rand2 );
152 
153  intBelow = intAbove;
154  intBelow--;
155  valAbove = mapBelow->second.at( 0 ).at( intAbove - mapBelow->second.at( 1 ).begin() );
156  valBelow = mapBelow->second.at( 0 ).at( intBelow - mapBelow->second.at( 1 ).begin() );
157 
158  double resultBelow = this->InterpolateLinear( rand2, *intBelow, *intAbove, valBelow, valAbove );
159 
160  //interpolate between the results for energy areas above and below the kinetic energy of the electron
161  scatteringAngle_pi = this->InterpolateLinear( aKineticEnergy,
162  mapBelow->first,
163  mapAbove->first,
164  resultBelow,
165  resultAbove );
166 
167  return scatteringAngle_pi;
168  }
169 
170 }
